channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: How Malaysia's MH370 missteps eroded relatives' trust
Families confront officials
item.description: Despite Malaysia's assurance that debris found in Reunion Island is from missing MH370, some of those with loved ones aboard the flight are still not convinced. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

item.title: 'I can't speak'
item.description: K.S. Narendran, whose wife was aboard missing Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, may be more confused now than ever.

item.title: What next?
item.description: Could a small portion of a plane wing discovered on an Indian Ocean island be the clue investigators need to unlock one of aviation's biggest mysteries?

item.title: 'Dark side' of the moon caught on camera
Taiwan in cross hairs of typhoon
item.description: Residents in Taiwan are making final preparations before typhoon Soudelor, expected to make a direct hit early Saturday. CNN's Meteorologist Tom Sater has the latest.

item.title: ISIS claims deadly Saudi mosque blast
Climbers' remains found after 45 years
item.description: For decades, there was no sign of two Japanese climbers who went missing as they tried to scale the famed Matterhorn mountain.

item.title: Guru abused followers' children
item.description: As young girls in the 1990s, Shyama Rose and sisters Kate and Vesla Tonnessen loved living in Barsana Dham, the Austin, Texas, ashram of the International Society for Divine Love.

item.title: Jennifer Aniston, Justin Theroux marry
item.description: Hollywood's most famous engaged couple finally appears to have made it official.

item.title: Gadhafi's son beaten, tortured on tape?
Hostage threat in 'ISIS video'
item.description: In a video purportedly released by ISIS on Wednesday, a group claiming to be ISIS' branch in the Sinai Peninsula threatens to kill a Croatian hostage if Egypt doesn't release female Muslim prisoners in 48 hours.

item.title: Plague victim dies in Colorado
item.description: Centuries after ravaging millions, the plague has come to modern-day Colorado -- leaving a devastated family behind, after their loved one succumbed to the disease.

item.title: Taylor Swift spooked by fan
item.description: Taylor Swift looks shocked as a fan reaches for her ankle during her concert in Edmonton, Canada.

item.title: Egypt unveils new Suez Canal
item.description: Egypt has inaugurated a major expansion to the Suez Canal, totaling over $8 billion.

item.title: Tracker: Cecil fears realized
item.description: Before the global outrage over the killing of Cecil the lion, there was a researcher from Oxford University who tracked the lions for years in Zimbabwe. CNN's David McKenzie reports.

item.title: U.S. to have Gulf 'carrier gap'
item.description: The U.S. Navy will not be able to keep an aircraft carrier in the Persian Gulf for much of the fall season, according to a Navy official.

item.title: Jury duty for George W. Bush
item.description: Just call him Juror Number 43.

item.title: Colin Farrell joins 'Harry Potter'
item.description: Colin Farrell is ready to cast a spell.

item.title: Richards: Beatles album 'rubbish'
item.description: The Beatles' "Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band" may be regularly ranked among the greatest albums of all time, but it's nowhere near the top of Keith Richards' list.

item.title: Hiroshima: Artifacts of the atomic bomb
Jon Stewart, in his own words
item.description: When Jon Stewart signs off Thursday night after 16 years of hosting "The Daily Show," he'll leave a a gaping void in the world of political satire.

item.title: NFL star breaks the sound barrier
item.description: From being bullied in school to becoming a Super Bowl champion, Derrick Coleman's deafness hasn't got in the way of his dreams.

item.title: Would you stay in a Brazilian favela?
item.description: Those attending next year's Olympics in Rio de Janeiro will have some interesting accommodation options, as CNN's Shasta Darlington reports.

item.title: Eating spicy foods the key to a longer life?
What the ...? Scary-looking fish found in ocean's depths
Body painter makes models disappear
item.description: Artist Trina Merry camouflages her human canvases into their surrounding scenery and can create mesmerizing shapes out of multiple people.

item.title: Here's the brand celebrities can't get enough of
China + math Olympiad = rare U.S. victory
item.description: For the first time in 20 years, China has lost a world math championship to the United States -- and many in the world's most populous nation seem happy about it.

item.title: The world's highest paid actor is ...
item.description: Robert Downey Jr. has been named the world's highest paid actor for the third year in a row by Forbes, thanks in no small part to the power of the Chinese box office.

item.title: World's first unstealable bike?
item.description: Three young entrepreneurs claim to have solved a problem that makes every cyclist's blood boil -- they have invented the world's first "unstealable" bike.

item.title: Meet the new kings of South America
Ashes: England humiliate Australia
item.description: There is humiliation -- and then there's the humiliation of being completely decimated by your oldest and fiercest enemy.

item.title: Can Arsenal end league title drought?
World's 12 best spots for wild swimming
What if the next big thing in fashion wasn't wearable?
'Hell full of beautiful women, no mirrors'
7 ways to spot someone is being trafficked
Opinion: The myth of child prostitution
item.description: Last week saw the premiere of "Children for Sale: The Fight to End Human Trafficking," which exposes the hidden realities of child sex trafficking in the United States. It's a powerful documentary. But there's even more to the story.

item.title: Countries ranked: Who's fighting trafficking?
item.description: Cuba, Kenya and Saudi Arabia are doing better at fighting human trafficking. Egypt, Ghana and Bulgaria are doing worse.

item.title: Atomic bomb survivor shares survival story
item.description: Seventy years ago Chisako Takeoka survived the world's first attack with an atomic bomb. Since then, she has traveled the world sharing the horrors of her experience. Ivan Watson has her story.

item.title: Will Rio be ready for next year's Olympics?
item.description: CNN's Shasta Darlington takes a look at what Rio de Janerio is doing to get ready for the 2016 Olympic games.

item.title: Syrian refugees struggle to reach Hungary
item.description: Arwa Damon reports on the plight of migrants in Hungary in this CNN exclusive.

item.title: One tree grows 40 different types of fruit
item.description: Artist Sam Van Aken has created a series of trees that grow dozens of different types of stone fruits. He tells a TEDxManhattan conference that these trees are a research project, an art exhibit and a conservation mission.

item.title: Incredible smartphone holograms
item.description: Find out how to turn your smartphone into a thing of a future.

item.title: Touching this plant can blind you
item.description: Officials discovered giant hogweed plants growing in Michigan. Touching them can cause bruising, burning or even blindness. CNN affiliate WWMT reports.

item.title: Drawings show haunting memories of Hiroshima
Must-ride bicycle trips
item.description: The magic of the open road, trail or mountain has long captured the imaginations of cyclists, whether they are professional riders or weekend warriors.

item.title: Styling made accessible: Fashion for all abilities
Why we must never forget Hiroshima
Beirut's 1960s jet-set playgrounds
item.description: For several decades the name "Beirut" has conjured images of devastation and danger.

item.title: Buildings on verge of destruction
item.description: Go see them now, before it's too late: threatened by neglect, the elements, changing architectural trends or ruthless developers, these outstanding buildings are all fighting a hard battle for survival.

item.title: World's 10 most scenic airport approaches
item.description: For jaded air travelers, window seats are overrated.

item.title: Ruins of the Soviet space shuttle program
item.description: What was once the gleaming pride and joy of the Soviet space program now lies covered in dirt and bird droppings in a disused hangar in Kazakhstan.

item.title: NASA finds 'Earth's bigger, older cousin'
item.description: NASA said Thursday that its Kepler spacecraft has spotted "Earth's bigger, older cousin": the first nearly Earth-size planet to be found in the habitable zone of a star similar to our own.

item.title: 10 watches that changed history
item.description: Mechanical watchmaking is not a world of revolutions, it's a world of evolutions, where change comes only slowly and tradition is a sacred trust. In the five hundred or so years that watches have existed, however, there have been a few that have changed the watchmaking world. Some of these watches broke new ground in design, some in technology -- and some both. Here are ten that made history and became part of it at the same time.

item.title: Girl from Vietnam War photo: Where is she?
item.description: Even without the benefit of context, the image of a naked 9-year-old girl running for her life is as searing and indelible today as it was 43 years ago.

item.title: Capturing beauty around the world
item.description: To photographer Mihaela Noroc, beauty cannot be defined by one country, race or ethnicity.

item.title: The homeowners who refused to budge
